snippet: Ray LaHood, a Republican who served as transportation secretary, says the president gave up too easily on his promise to reach across the aisle.
abstract: Republican Ray LaHood, former Sec of Transportation in Pres Obama's first cabinet, criticizes president for espousing bipartisan approach to policy making that he says was never fully supported; comments appear in LaHood's newly published memoir Seeking Bipartisanship: My Life in Politics.
lead_paragraph: Ray LaHood, a Republican who served as transportation secretary, says the president gave up too easily on his promise to reach across the aisle.

headline.main: Promised Bipartisanship, Obama Adviser Found Disappointment
headline.print_headline: Promise of Bipartisanship Fails to Come True for an Ex-Cabinet Secretary

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Seeking Bipartisanship: My Life in Politics (Book)
